Instruction: Preheat oven to 425Â°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Combine dry ingredients: In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder, sugar, and salt.
Cut in butter: Cut in cold butter using a pastry blender or two knives until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Add wet ingredients: In a small bowl, whisk together buttermilk. Add to dry ingredients and stir until just combined.
Form biscuits: Drop by rounded tablespoons onto prepared baking sheet, spacing them about 2 inches apart.
Bake: Bake for 12-15 minutes, or until golden brown.
Cool: Let cool on baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.
Combine strawberries and sugar: In a large bowl, combine sliced strawberries, sugar, and lemon juice. Let stand for 30 minutes, or until juices form.
Whip cream: In a chilled bowl, beat heavy whipping cream and powdered sugar until stiff peaks form.
Add vanilla: Stir in vanilla extract.
Cut biscuits: Split each biscuit in half horizontally.
Layer: Place the bottom half of a biscuit on a plate, top with whipped cream, then sliced strawberries. Place the top half of the biscuit on top.
Serve: Repeat with remaining biscuits, whipped cream, and strawberries. Serve immediately.
